guiSET.core

Class Slider

  • java.lang.Object
    • guiSET.core.Control
      • guiSET.core.Slider
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Knob

    public class Slider
extends Control
    A value slider/progress bar based on the data type float. The orientation can either be set to horizontally or vertically. The value is changed through dragging or clicking on a position on the slider. Also, by setting setWheelEnabled(boolean), the mouse wheel can be used to increment or decrement the value stepwise (amount can be set through scrollSpeed).
    Author:
    Mc-Zen

        public void setValue(float value)

        Parameters:

      • setMinValue

        public void setMinValue(float minValue)

        Parameters:
        minValue - minValue

      • setWheelEnabled

        public void setWheelEnabled(boolean wheelEnabled)
        Specify if scrolling while mouse is over the slider changes the value. Default is true.
        Parameters:
        wheelEnabled - wheelEnabled

      • setRelativeWheelSpeed

        public void setRelativeWheelSpeed(float setRelativeWheelSpeed)
        Set the speed for changing the value with the mouse wheel; the value represents the relative speed in percent of the set interval length (abs(min-max)). The default value of 0.02 changes the current value by 2 percent of the interval length. The user needs to turn his/her mouse wheel 50 ticks to get from minimum value to maximum value.
        Parameters:
        setRelativeWheelSpeed - setRelativeWheelSpeed

        public void setValueChangeListener(java.lang.String methodName,
                                   java.lang.Object target)
        Set a value-change listener. The event is also triggered when the value is changed programatically.
        Parameters:
        methodName - methodName
        target - target

      • setValueChangeListener

        public void setValueChangeListener(Control.Predicate1<Slider> lambda)
        Set a value-change listener lambda. The event is also triggered when the value is changed programatically. Event arguments: the Slider whose state has changed
        Parameters:
        lambda - lambda expression with Slider parameter
